name: Sol Pelicano

reviews.title: Great service and nature, but poor food
reviews.text: We stayed in Sol Pelicno from December 18 to 23. The overall experience was good, considering that the service was excellent and all Cuban people working in the hotel were extremely friendly and welcoming. The beach was beautiful, but mostly wavy, kind of like in Punta Cana. The weather was great, just like in summer, although you could expect to wear a light sweater in the evening. The room was very basic, but clean and nice. The food, however, left us quite disappointed. We did not like the beach restaurant at all (considering that the food was the same every day, there were many flies, and there was hardly any choice). The Zun-Zun snack-bar next to the pool had good chicken sandwiches, and a la carta restaurant was fine but nothing fancy. Make sure you go to the Siriana or Perceo beaches, they were great! The cost of taking the train there and back is only 2 pesos per person, or you could try to walk west along the beach for about an hour (you could see iguanas on the way there).

reviews.title: Loved the beach
reviews.text: Just returned from Sol Pelicano, Cay Largo, my third trip. Twice last year (April & November) and again this past week in November. Previously I had thoroughly enjoyed my stay, and again I did enjoy my time there, but this time the food was awful, nowhere near as good as before. The dinner buffet was boring and often cold, and sometimes the meat was not cooked through eg the roast beef was red and running, the roast pork on another evening was also very very pink and running. I like my beef med. Rare, but this was rare, very rare. (read raw.) The vegetables were not good, the potatoes (when you got them) were mashed slop – where are the roasted potatoes that we had before? To be honest, I really liked the breakfast, as you can have your eggs cooked the way you like them, the croissants were quite good, however there was only one type of jam that was available. Also the A la Carte, (La Yana) was so disappointing. Last year the fillet mignon was fabulous, really tender and tasty, and the smoked salmon was delightful. This year, it was “Beef escalote” and believe me it was as tough as a piece of shoe leather. The best food we had was at the beach bar, everyday they had chicken which was very very good, and French fries which were also great. There was also fish and pizza available, plus some salads. We loved our lunches, and Thomas the chef was very good. The beach bar is the best place for food and drinks during the day time. Unfortunately they did not have the beach bar open for dinner on this occasion (last year it was open and quite good). The beach bar staff are wonderful and mix great drinks and have great personalities.

reviews.title: Not for snubs!!
reviews.text: We cannot comment on the pool bar, as we only had drinks there on one occasion. However, the pool is lovely and clean and very large, and the surrounding area is full of plants and flowers.

reviews.title: Pictures worth more than thousand words
reviews.text: The lounge bar serves up some pretty good drinks too… our only complaint is that they ran out of gin during our stay. In fact, so did the beach bar. Still, there’s always something you can drink.

reviews.title: A picture worth more than thousand words
reviews.text: The beach is really why we go there. It is the fine white sand that never gets hot no matter how high the temperature. There are tons of palapas and beach chairs, but beware, there are no cushions for these plastic lounge chairs. We take our own cushions, and if you have a cheap ‘blow up’ mattress, that would be good too. Sitting for hours on rigid plastic is a little hard on the you know where.!!!! The beach goes on forever. There is another beach that you can go to, Sirena Beach. They have transportation 3 times a day to take you there for a cost of 2 pesos each. Of course you can walk, (as we do) and it will take you 1.5 hours each way. The best idea is to take the ‘train’ and then walk back. There is a restaurant and bar on this beach, but it is not included, so you will have to purchase your drinks.

reviews.title: Perfect place to relax
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week (Aug 5-12) at the Sol Pelicano. This was our 8th trip to Cuba but our first to Cayo Largo. The pricing for the Sol Pelicano was very good and though we knew it was only rated as a 3.5 star hotel we were prepared for whatever the hotel might lack.

reviews.title: Sol Pelicano - Very Beautiful
reviews.text: The flight down with Westjet was great, nice leather seats plenty of leg room and on time.

reviews.title: great vacation for relaxation
reviews.text: Clearing through the airport went very quickly and within a short time we were at the hotel. Check in took about 1/2 hour.

reviews.title: What Italians ???
reviews.text: Our room was basic, nothing fancy. It was however clean no bugs, no strange odours, it was on the second floor and although we did not ask for ocean view we could see the ocean from our room.

reviews.title: Beautiful Beaches and Sunshine Everyday!
reviews.text: I know a lot of people complain about the food but both my husband and myself found the food to be above average compared to some of the other resorts we have visited in Cuba. There was plenty of variety , for the most part it was hot and there was always plenty available no matter how late you came into the restaurant. It was opened from 7-10 for dinner and 7-10am for breakfast. I can not imagine any one that could not find something they liked to eat.

reviews.title: Worth the money but...
reviews.text: A group of 12, we were there from Feb 23 till March 3rd. Great Weather, very very hot. Hotel rooms r OK, don't expect 5 stars... but lots of mosquitoes which become a real nuisance at night time, my girl had at least 60 bites on her legs (she wears skirts often...), the baby that came with us had his face covered with bites (he slept in his crib outside). Bring a mosquito net for ur room with a hook u can stick on the plaster celling (not screw). The food was actually pretty good for Cuba. It is true that staff at first a real friendly and then less and less as time goes by. In this resort Tip is not just a word, just don't give too much; it does not increase the quality of service. Went to Paradise Beach; lots of litter, a real shame. The beach at the resort: very nice, specially if u like waves, to the Katamaran tour: it's worth the $. The entertainment is not that great, don't worry about the italians, they r not that loud and some of them actually don't walk around with their nose in the air. The only dissapointment was our departure; what a mess and transport from the resort to the airport was very dangerous to say the least; they had us pack into small buses with our suitcases on our laps...with a driver who thought he was on a race track... then 4 check- in counters for 180 people and a great mosquitoe welcome comittee (we waited 1 1/2 hours to pass customs). But overall this resort is worth the price.

reviews.title: Sol Pelicano so-so
reviews.text: The staff...exceptional..wish I could bring them all to Canada! Hardest working people I have ever met.

reviews.title: Love Cayo Largo (2nd time visitors)
reviews.text: I was here with 6 pals between 24-29 years old...not for us...too quiet.

reviews.title: Return from a one week trip to Cayo Largo Sol Pelicano resort
reviews.text: xxx We were like the only crowd from Toronto...no one speaks english...well very little...do not expect to mingle with any guests...very cliquey.

reviews.title: Would never go back!
reviews.text: Shows were great...food was crappy..but hey...it's Cuba.

reviews.title: We'll be back!!
reviews.text: It's hard to believe that it's already been one year since we visited this lovely resort. We had an absolutely fantastic time. The resort was great and the staff, especially the servers, were very accommodating...always a smile! The food was very good and so were the many drinks. But I must say, the best part of all is the BEACH! Wow, it is quite breathtaking and the white sand is so soft! We will definitely be back to this resort!

reviews.title: Love this small paradise
reviews.text: We were at Pelicano from Jan 27th to Feb 3rd....the room are basic but very neat...saw no bugs in the room...very nice and big shower , pleasant for two!

reviews.title: Had a great time!
reviews.text: The food it is Cuba.....do not expect more....but it was very good...would never die from starvation...always very complete.

reviews.title: I'll be back...
reviews.text: The site was extremely clean...no bugs...the pool also very clean...nothing to complaint about.

reviews.title: Too many problems! Don't go there
reviews.text: The italiens a bit loud....

description: Located in Cayo Largo del Sur, in the Caribbean Sea. All Inclusive Four-Star Resort with 307 rooms. Its comfortable accommodations offer guests the chance to enjoy a peaceful and calm vacation. The property faces 600 meters of beach, famous for its perennially cool white-sand. Fun-packed recreation programs for both children and adults. Recommended for families.Guest Rooms307 rooms: 259 Standard, 36 Standard Ocean View, 12 Junior SuiteDining3 Restaurants (A la Carta, Buffet, A la carte and mini-buffet), 2 Cafeterias, 2 Bars
